messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Twelth Anniversary of Always Learning
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for all the kid words.  I m back from vacation, have napped it off, am back on schedule and see that I misspelled Twelfth. Sorry to good spellers who
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for all the kid words. I'm back from vacation, have napped it off, am back on schedule and see that I misspelled "Twelfth."
Sorry to good spellers who kept seeing that. :-)

I'm glad to be home. Projects at the moment are an interview in Spanish tomorrow that will be available to view at some point (I'll speak English, there will be translators, it will all be one video, switching from one speaker to another, so it can be understood in English or Spanish either). I'll bring that link when it's available.

Just Add Light continues. http://justaddlightandstir.blogspot.com
That's three years and three months old (I missed the anniversary, and I would've guessed two and a half years; time flies!), and has 1183 posts, with a randomizer (thanks to Joyce who found the code) in the upper right where it says "Surprise me!"

Wednesday chats continue. This week is the last of a series of chats on sections of The Big Book of Unschooling.
http://chatnotes-unschooling.blogspot.com
After that we'll come up with some other serie of topics.
This is a two-hour text chat, noon to two mountain time, evening in Europe.

I work on the webpage and announce changes and additions here:
http://aboutunschooling.blogspot.com

I share ideas that don't necessarily fit into other places here:
http://thinkingsticks.blogspot.com
In my opinion, that should be the most popular thing among unschoolers, but it languishes. Still, I use it myself to collect and remember and connect and appreciate.

Then there's my newest project, the wheelbarrow collection.
http://wheelbarrowthings.blogspot.com
I have things I haven't put there yet. People have started helping me collect them. :-)
I think wheelbarrows are elegant and fairly simple and everywhere and ignored.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: Twelth Anniversary of Always Learning
messages.msgSnippet: I d also like to share my thanks with Sandra and all the others who so thoughtfully post here. My relationships with my husband and with our children have both
messages.messageBody:
I'd also like to share my thanks with Sandra and all the others who so thoughtfully post here. My relationships with my husband and with our children have both benefited beyond measure from what I continue to learn here. Thanks for the gift of your time, experience and patience!

Tori

messages.subject: RE: RE: RE: Twelth Anniversary of Always Learning
messages.msgSnippet: I ve been a member of this list since 2007 also and would also like to say Happy Anniversary! and thank you, Sandra, for providing a place of reassurance and
messages.messageBody:
I've been a member of this list since 2007 also and would also like to say "Happy Anniversary!" and thank you, Sandra, for providing a place of reassurance and good sense during the nine years my son was "growing without school".


Bob



---In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, <rjofm@...> wrote:

Happy Anniversary!

I have been reading advice from this list since 2007. Thank you, Sandra, and all who offer advice and those who write in with questions/problems. Thank you for helping me to make my relationships with my kiddos and husband better.

 

Jessica

 

 



---In alwayslearning@yahoogroups.com, <saravazzzz@...> wrote:

Happy Anniversary!

I can not express by words the gratitude to you, Sandra, and all the wonderfull members of this list that keep it the best resource to learn about unschooling and much more!

Thank you!

messages.messageBody:

-Michelle & Hub Kirkpatrick

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Twelth Anniversary of Always Learning
messages.msgSnippet: Happy birthday and thank you so much for helping me and my family. I m not sure when I joined this list, but I think it s been at least four years. In that
messages.messageBody:
Happy birthday and thank you so much for helping me and my family.

I'm not sure when I joined this list, but I think it's been at least four years. In that time, my relationships with everyone, especially family, have improved and our lives are sweeter and more joyful :)

Rachel

messages.messageBody:

Alex Polikowsky
